intro: Sarcotheca celebica, commonly known as the Celebes sarcocarp, is a rare flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, seed-containing pods. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
